content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's a function that does what you described:
```julia
function clean_column(col)
    col = lowercase(col)  # convert to lower case
    col = strip(col)      # remove leading/trailing whitespaces
    col = replace(col, r"\s+", "_")  # replace spaces and hyphens with underscore
    return col
end
```
You can use this function like so:
```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("Another Column")
"another_column"

julia> clean_column("Column with hyphen")
"column-with-hyphen"
```
